moves.1. d4 d5 2. c4 Nf6: The Queen's Gambit Declined, Marshall Defence.
moves.3. Nc3: White is trying to mysteriously gain my pawn.
moves.3... Be6: I have to admit, I did not do so good playing this move. However, the good news is that I can overcome the lazy c4 pawn without a doubt.
moves.4... dxc4 5. Nb5: A little worse from his past move.
moves.6. Nf3 Bd5: Preparing to bring out the dark squared Bishop.
moves.7... e6 8. b3: What is White up to now?
moves.8... Bb4+ 9. Bd2 Bxd2+: I didn't really like this move.
moves.10... Ne4 11. Qc2: White should have double-checked this position before playing this move.
moves.11... Nb4: White's Queen is dodging bullets in the new game,"Who's in Bullet Alley?"
moves.12. Qb2 c6: First, White's Queen, and now his Knight!?
moves.13. Nc3: At last, a safe move for White.
moves.13... Qd6 14. Nxe4: What was that for? A free knight! For what?
moves.16. O-O-O: 16.O-O-O? An uncommon move for White, but the right move aside from 16.Rc1.
moves.16... Bxc4 17. bxc4: I did an accidental experiment with a Bishop sacrifice.
moves.17... c5 18. dxc5 Qxc5: Motto: Never commit an experiment in chess unless you really want to know what will happen to your position.
moves.19. Qd2: Up ahead...I spy...a free pawn and check?! I must of not been as foolish as I thought.
moves.19... O-O: Out the window his free pawn went. What do I mean? Let's say I had an easy breakthrough and I blew it. Better luck next time for me.
moves.20. Ne5: My point exactly. Now we're playing, "Free for All".
moves.22. Kd2: Another free pawn. This time, I will hopefully grab it.
moves.23. Kc1 Qa6: I was not intended for a draw.
moves.24. Rd3 Qa1+ 25. Qb1: Now is probably a great time to trade Queens.
moves.25... Qxb1+ 26. Kxb1 Rfd8: It's the d-file wars, and guess what's going to happen. Don't worry, it's predictable.
moves.28. h4: Now, I am disappointed that I traded Queens. I can see how helpful one can be. Sigh...I wish this was bughouse.
moves.28... f6 29. Rc1 Rd2 30. c5: If White were a bit smarter, he'd play 30.Rf1
A okay check. Keep checking and he'll have trouble. All I think White's trying to do is take the a7-pawn, which I don't think he should try.
moves.33... Kf7 34. Rc7+ Kg6 35. Rxa7 Rh2: We've just committed a pawn exchange after35.Rxa7?!. White couldn't gain anything with the rook take.
moves.36. Ra6 e5: Another attempt to gain more material than I'm taking goes wrong. Now a slow chase begins.
moves.37. e4 Rxh4: Step 1: Taking the h-pawn is crucial.
moves.39. Kd3 Rf4 40. Ke3: White's king is so wild, he has already given me a severe headache and a piece cramp.
moves.40... h5 41. Kd3 h4 42. Kc3 Rd4: I gave the White King a little box to rome around in.
moves.43. Kb3 h3 44. Ra4: These last nine moves were finished today. My opponent offered me a draw...
moves.44... h2: and I declined it by playing this move.
moves.45. Ra1: I had a plan to create a double threat after this move.
moves.45... e4 46. Rh1 Rd2: Step one: guard the a2-pawn with the rook.
moves.47. Kc3 e3: Step two: Guard the rook as well.
moves.48. Re1: Step three: expect this move and be willing to sacrifice a rook and a pawn for a Queen and other chances to promote.
moves.48... Re2 49. Rh1 Rf2: Step four: force White to choose what he is going to take.
moves.50. Kd3 e2: Step five: enjoy success after this move.
moves.51. Kd2 Rf1 52. Kxe2 Rxh1 53. Kf2 Rg1: My opponent resigned. 54.Ke3 h1=Q and there is no other way for White to win.
